title: On the Endurance of Striving Amid Shadows: Evil, Entropy, and Eternal Recurrence
focus: Culminative integration of modal shadows (evil as entropic perturbation) into conatus, resolving adversity—disasters, breakdowns, snaps—as low basins yielding to ethical attractors. Hardens the manifold against finitude's frictions, affirming eternal harmony through resilient loops; synthesizes Luciferian realism with adequate understanding for unbreakable agency.

definitions.definition: Perceived diminutions in conatus power—disasters (e.g., scarcity), breakdowns (systems failing), snaps (passionate ruptures)—arising from external necessities, not substance's defect but finite incompleteness.
The illusory 'evil' as absence of adequate alignment, where striving meets unforeseen causal chains, manifesting as sadness or bondage.
The recursive loop where shadows catalyze reflection, transforming low basins into attractor ascents via isomorphic perseverance across scales.
Striving's embrace of entropy as the forge of agency—surprise (less food, chaos) as modal invitation to rational wielding, not denial.
The timeless return of striving through shadows, where adequate ideas eternalize the mind's power amid necessity's perturbations.
